articles.author: Sibusiso Mjikeliso
articles.title: Ex-Proteas opener Hudson recalls Warne sledging battles: 'The nicest guy off the field'
articles.description: Andrew Hudson paid tribute to the "huge competitor", Shane Warne, who died of natural causes in Thailand last Friday, aged 52. Hudson has a unique history with late great Aussie cricketer, who infamously sledged him in Johannesburg in 1994.
articles.content:
• Andrew Hudson has a unique history with late great Aussie cricketer Shane Warne, who infamously sledged him in Johannesburg in 1994.

articles.author: Guardian staff reporter
articles.title: Shane Warne death: friend describes final meal of Vegemite toast at Thailand resort
articles.description: ‘Geez, you can’t beat Vegemite … always great wherever you are’. Australian cricket great died from heart attack in Koh Samui
articles.content: Shane Warnes last meal was a plate of Vegemite and toast shared with a friend at the Thailand resort where he died hours later. The poignant detail was revealed by The Sporting News CEO Tom Hall, who… [+2683 chars]

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Shane Warne: Australian cricket legend died from natural causes - police
articles.description: Thai police say there's no sign of foul play in the cricketer's death while on holiday on Koh Samui.
articles.content:
Image caption, Warne had been on holiday on Koh Samui when he died of a suspected heart attack

articles.title: Shane Warne's family releases heartfelt tributes to 'the best father and mate'
articles.description: The parents of cricket great Shane Warne say his sudden death in Thailand is a "never-ending nightmare" and "a tragedy we will never come to terms with".
articles.content:

articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
